verses.verse: By the rivers<WH5104> of Babylon<WH894>, There we sat down<WH3427>, yea<WH1058>, we wept, When we remembered<WH2142> Zion<WH6726>.
Upon the willows<WH6155> in the midst<WH8432> thereof We hanged<WH8518> up our harps<WH3658>.

For there they that led us captive<WH7617> required<WH7592> of us songs<WH1697>, And they that wasted<WH8437> us required of us mirth<WH8057>, saying<WH7891>, Sing us one of the songs<WH7892> of Zion<WH6726>.
How shall we sing<WH7891> Jehovah<WH3068>'s song<WH7892> In a foreign<WH5236> land<WH127>?
If I forget<WH7911> thee<WH3389>, O Jerusalem, Let my right hand<WH3225> forget her skill<WH7911>.
Let my tongue<WH3956> cleave<WH1692> to the roof of my mouth<WH2441>, If I remember<WH2142> thee not<WH5927>; If I prefer not Jerusalem<WH3389> Above my chief<WH7218> joy<WH8057>.

Remember <WH2142>, O Jehovah<WH3068>, against the children<WH1121> of Edom<WH123> The day<WH3117> of Jerusalem<WH3389>; Who said<WH559>, Rase<WH6168> it<WH6168>, rase it<WH3247>, Even to the foundation thereof.
O daughter<WH1323> of Babylon<WH894>, that art to be destroyed<WH7703>, Happy<WH835> shall he be<WH7999>, that rewardeth thee As thou hast served us<WH1580>.
Happy <WH835> shall he be<WH270>, that taketh and dasheth<WH5310> thy little ones<WH5768> Against the rock<WH5553>.
